meanings.sent1: The village was haunted by dibbukim, spirits that roamed the streets at night.
meanings.sent2: The dibbukim were said to be trapped souls seeking refuge in the living.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous dibbukim played pranks on unsuspecting villagers, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The dibbukim were like shadows, lingering in the corners of the old synagogue.
meanings.sent5: The legend of the dibbukim spread fear throughout the countryside.

meanings.definition: Dibbukim: a malevolent spirit in Jewish folklore
meanings.sent1: The old house was said to be haunted by dibbukim, causing fear among the townspeople.
meanings.sent2: According to legend, the dibbukim would possess those who dared to enter the abandoned cemetery.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous dibbukim would hide objects just to watch people search frantically for them.
meanings.sent4: The presence of the dibbukim was felt as a chill in the air, sending shivers down the spine.
meanings.sent5: The malevolent dibbukim whispered dark secrets in the dead of night.

meanings.definition: Dibbukim: possessing spirits in Jewish mysticism
meanings.sent1: The rabbi performed a ritual to banish the dibbukim from the tormented soul.
meanings.sent2: The presence of the dibbukim was felt as a heavy weight on the afflicted person's chest.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous dibbukim would make the furniture move on its own, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: The dibbukim were like invisible chains, binding the soul to the earthly realm.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious dibbukim whispered ancient incantations in the ears of the possessed.
